Module com.library
Package com.library

Class AppState

java.lang.Object
com.library.AppState
public class AppState extends Object
This class represents the application's state. It contains managers that are managing user, admin, book, and loan data. It also contains services that help perform opetations to these data structures. It uses the Singleton design pattern to ensure only one instance of this class exists at a time.

      public BookManager getBookManager()

      Returns:
      BookManager - The instance of BookManager used to manage book data. This method does not take any parameters and returns the BookManager instance. The returned BookManager instance is used to perform operations on book data.

    • getUserService

      public UserService getUserService()
      This method returns the instance of UserService. UserService is responsible for performing operations related to user data, such as user registration,deletion and user information retrieval.
      Returns:
      UserService - The instance of UserService used to perform operations on user data. This method does not take any parameters and returns the UserService instance. The returned UserService instance is used to interact with the user data and perform operations like user registration, deletion, and user information retrieval.

    • getLoanService

      public LoanService getLoanService()
      This method returns the instance of LoanService. LoanService is responsible for performing operations related to loan data, such as adding, updating, and deleting loans. It also interacts with other managers like UserManager to perform operations like checking user eligibility for loan.
      Returns:
      LoanService - The instance of LoanService used to perform operations on loan data. This method does not take any parameters and returns the LoanService instance. The returned LoanService instance is used to interact with the loan data and perform operations like adding, updating, and deleting loans. It also provides methods to check user eligibility for loan and perform other related operations.

    • getBookService

      public BookService getBookService()
      This method returns the instance of BookService. BookService is responsible for performing operations related to book data, such as adding, updating, and deleting books. It interacts with the BookManager to perform these operations.
      Returns:
      BookService - The instance of BookService used to perform operations on book data. This method does not take any parameters and returns the BookService instance. The returned BookService instance is used to interact with the book data and perform operations like adding, updating, and deleting books.

    • getUserDeletionService

      public UserDeletionService getUserDeletionService()
      This method returns the instance of UserDeletionService. UserDeletionService is responsible for performing operations related to user deletion, such as deleting a user and handling related operations like deleting loans and books associated with the user. It interacts with other services like UserService, LoanService, and BookService to perform these operations.
      Returns:
      UserDeletionService - The instance of UserDeletionService used to perform operations on user deletion. This method does not take any parameters and returns the UserDeletionService instance. The returned UserDeletionService instance is used to interact with the user data and perform operations like deleting a user, along with deleting related loans and books associated with the user.

    • getSessionLoginCheckService

      public SessionLoginCheckService getSessionLoginCheckService()
      This method returns the instance of SessionLoginCheckService. SessionLoginCheckService is responsible for checking the login status of a user or an admin in the current session. It interacts with other managers like SessionManager, UserManager, and AdminManager to perform these operations.
      Returns:
      SessionLoginCheckService - The instance of SessionLoginCheckService used to check the login status. This method does not take any parameters and returns the SessionLoginCheckService instance. The returned SessionLoginCheckService instance is used to interact with the session data and perform operations like checking the login status of a user or an admin.

    • getShowAlertService

      public ShowAlertService getShowAlertService()
      This method returns the instance of ShowAlertService. ShowAlertService is responsible for displaying alerts to the user interface. It can be used to show various types of alerts, such as success, error, warning, and informational messages.
      Returns:
      ShowAlertService - The instance of ShowAlertService used to display alerts. This method does not take any parameters and returns the ShowAlertService instance. The returned ShowAlertService instance is used to interact with the user interface and display alerts.

    • getDeleteLoanService

      public DeleteLoanService getDeleteLoanService()
      This method returns the instance of DeleteLoanService. DeleteLoanService is responsible for performing operations related to deleting loans amd books, such as deleting a loan and handling related operations like updating book availability or vice versa. It interacts with other services like LoanManager and BookService to perform these operations.
      Returns:
      DeleteLoanService - The instance of DeleteLoanService used to perform operations on loan deletion. This method does not take any parameters and returns the DeleteLoanService instance. The returned DeleteLoanService instance is used to interact with the loan data and perform operations like deleting a loan, along with updating the book availability and vice versa.

    • getSerializationService

      public SerializationService getSerializationService()
      This method returns the instance of SerializationService. SerializationService is responsible for handling the serialization and deserialization of data, such as saving and loading data from a file .
      Returns:
      SerializationService - The instance of SerializationService used for data serialization and deserialization. This method does not take any parameters and returns the SerializationService instance. The returned SerializationService instance is used to interact with the file system or database, and perform operations like saving and loading data.
